root: ^Look, you were so small back then.
^That was the worst Lifting I’ve attended, I slept through the entire thing.
^Well yeah, babies have a habit of sleeping. I hope the Engineers will do something about that soon.
^Oh you were also so cute with that skyscraper costume!
^No I wasn't! That costume was highly inappropriate for the lifting!
^Nonsense, you really took the theme to another level.
^Can we go on? I hate that I even touched the drums.
^Music is frivolous, and softens the brain. That’s why it’s only people below layer 30 who play it.
^Mrs. Morrison says that it’s only the low born who play it.
^There’s nothing wrong with music, I was in a band when I studied.
^Mom! You can’t just say things like that.
^Well, I was in a band, and it was fun.
^Oh, those were your very first Skyscraper Blocks™! You played with them for hours.
^They don’t make them like they used to.
^Well you’re still playing with the ones that we got you from the store last-
^OH! We have to go buy clothes before they close today!
^The Lifting! It’s happening in a few days!
^Can’t you just use the same outfit from your birthday? We can go get you a book instead.
^They don’t match this year's Lifting theme. Come on mom, you promised!
^We can go later, why don’t we play a game?
^No mom, we have to go soon, or there will only be low-hanging clothes left!
^Come on mom, stop lounging around! If I don’t get the best clothes, I’ll never get into the Engineers.
^Fine, get your shoes on and give me a moment
